title: Eric Clapton-Give Me Strength-The '74-'75 Recordings 5 CD [2013]
description:
Eric Clapton - Give Me Strenght - The '74-'75 Recordings [2013/CD/FLAC/Lossless]

In early 1974, after a three-year absence that followed Eric ClaptonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s major success with Derek and the DominosÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ seminal album Layla And Other Assorted Love Songs, which sealed his stature as one of rockÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s most revered guitarists, a rejuvenated and musically refreshed Clapton stepped into the recording studio and staged a massive resurgence with his 1974/1975 trilogy of albumsÃ¢â‚¬â€461 Ocean Boulevard, which featured his first No. 1 hit single Ã¢â‚¬Å“I Shot The Sheriff,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ ThereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s One In Every Crowd and the live E.C. Was Here Ã¢â‚¬â€ standing as one of the most remarkable rebirths in rockÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s history. Those albums decisively cemented the guitarist as both a musical and commercial force, while successfully staking out an entirely new set of creative challenges.

"Give Me Strength: The 1974 / 1975 Recording" featuring a wealth of unreleased recordings, outtakes, studio sessions and live recordings. E.C. Was Here remixed and expanded features live tracks from Long Beach Arena (including unreleased versions of Crossroads, I Shot The Sheriff, Layla and Little Wing), the Hammersmith Odeon, Nassau Coliseum and Providence Civic Center. The Freddie King Criteria Studio Sessions featuring the previously unreleased versions of Ã¢â‚¬Å“Boogie FunkÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ and the full unreleased 22 minute version of Ã¢â‚¬Å“Gambling Woman BluesÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½
